title: Ali boxing poster
content:
The ALI and FRAZIER font.

Anyone?

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015154905im_/http:/typophile.com/files/3i_6416.jpg)
author: Chris Dean

comments.content:
Hi Christopher,

except for the ‘A’, [Futura Black](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015154905/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/futura_black_ot_std/?sample_text=ALI%20vs.%20FRAZIER&sample_size=48) is very similar.  
F

Not quite Futura Black (the A doesn’t match).

Edit : Florian, you’re too fast.

Yes, and that was my first guess too, yet I can't seem to find it on my HD. I have Berthold, ITC and Adobe versions but none of then have a "black" weight.

Does it perhaps have a different name I can't recall?

It's only $30 so if push comes to shove, I can simply buy it again. Kind of a rush job.

c
It’s not a weight of Futura but a single display face related to Futura, hence the name.
You guys made me remember that Futura Black!

[http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/futura\_black\_stencil\_ot\_std/](http://web.archive.org/web/20131015154905/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/futura_black_stencil_ot_std/ "http://www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/urw/futura\_black\_stencil\_ot\_std/")

I'll tell you the story once the job is out the door.

It's not perfect, but the A is a little closer.

I'm guessing it was hand done regardless.

Thanks a lot folks. I love the help I can get here.

c
And how do I turn a word into a link?
And how do I turn a word into a link? With HTML: ``_your word(s) here_ ``
